turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't know the last time I've been out of the city... Hey, my arms are tanning. I used to tan great. We gotta stop soon so'se I can check on Spencer.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'm sorry... I can't hear you. I can't turn my head all the way yet... tell her we can't hear her.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Do you want to know what happened with my parents?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Yes. I really would.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No, let me pull over so I can pay full attention.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't blame you... This is a monumental first day out... You sad or anything?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No... Nervous. It would be very rough, Carol, if you weren't along.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: What a nice compliment.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Was this supposed to be your room?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Our room. I don't want to see him and he's not going to come knocking on your door.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Can you not be violent?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I don't think so. You need help with the pants?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No!!!

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm going to take a big bath and order a big meal.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Uh-huh...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: I'm sorry... are you okay?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Well, considering everything's horrible and tomorrow I have to face my parents... Don't ask me ... I'm sick of my own complaints ... got to get me a new set of thoughts.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Why? What have you been thinking about?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: How to die, mostly.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Can you believe in our little mix you're the good roommate.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Good night.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I've got to sketch you.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: No... Absolutely not. I'm shyer than you think. I give the wrong impression sometimes and...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I haven't even been thinking about sketching for weeks.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Stop staring. Do a vase.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: But you're beautiful... your skin glows.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Thanks. But I just want to take a bath and...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: That long neck -- the line of you... you're porcelain... your back goes on forever. You're classic... you're why cavemen chiseled on walls...

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: All right, cut me a break.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: We held each other. It was better than sex. What I need he gave me great.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I just love her.  How're you doing?

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: But what about...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'll take care of myself --

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: One night with me!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You think you're kidding.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I love you...  Let him take you home.

turns.speaker: CAROL
turns.text: Don't want to. I love you.

turns.speaker: CHERYL
turns.text: What the heck are those for?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No. No. Get Carol.

turns.speaker: CHERYL
turns.text: I'm filling in. We don't know if she's coming back. She might have to get a job closer to home.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What are you trying to do to me?

turns.speaker: CHERYL
turns.text: What the heck do you mean?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hey, elephant girl, call her or something...  just let her do my one meal here. I'll pay whatever. I'll wait.  Do it!!!

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Help!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: If you want to see me you will not do this. You will make an appointment...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Explain to me how you can diagnose someone as "obsessive compulsive disorder" and then act like I have any choice in barging in.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: There's not going to be a debate. You must leave.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You said you could help me -- what was that -- a tease?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I can help you if you take the responsibility to keep regular app --

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You changed the room around...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Two years ago...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I also regrew my beard...  but you're not interested in changes in me... so it's like I always told you...  when it comes to people you...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Shhhhhhh. I don't have this mountain of available time...  I got to get to my restaurant on time. Do you know how hard it is for me to be here?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Yes.  No.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: He's genuinely upsetting, isn't he?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Won't worry about it. You go ahead.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey, hey...  Haaa...  bad but temporary. The nurses say it's much better than you looked three weeks ago...  the hand will come back...  they're sure...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Jackie, will you hand me the mirror?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: So, what's new anyway? How's Verdell?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Your neighbor -- Udall -- is taking care of him.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: How could you do that? He'll hurt him.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, I promise...  not a chance. I own this guy. There was no one else. I'm on the move too much. Trust me.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You are very certain my dog is okay...  because you have no idea...

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yes. Your dog is fine, Simon.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'm sorry that I'm not taking you.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: So am I, Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Simon, you've got to get dressed.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What I know is that as long as you keep your work zipped up around me, I don't give a fuck what or where you shove your show. Are we being neighbors for now?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Definitely a package you don't want to open or touch.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hope you find him. I love that dog.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No touch. No touch. No touch.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You may think you can intimidate the whole world with your attitude, but I grew up in Hell. My grandmother had more attitude. You don't intimidate me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Police! Police! Fucking crooked police...  doughnut-munching morons help me!  Assault and battery and you're black.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Shhhh now. I like Simon. I like him enough to batter you unrecognizable if you verbally abuse him or so much as touch his dog again. Meanwhile, I'll try and think how you can make this up to him.  I hate doing this. I'm an art dealer.  Have a nice day. Party!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You're taking him...  yes...  you're taking him -- this will clear the books. One night. You want to say "no" to me? Try...  because I've never felt as nuts as I do right this second. I almost want you to try saying "no."

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm not saying nothing to you.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Thanks for looking after him.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hey, where are you going? You can't do this.  I can't take a dog.  Nobody's ever been in here before.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: You don't want to mess with me today. I'll figure something else out tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: How's Verdell doing?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: He's a pain in the ass.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Simon's home. I was sort of hoping you could keep the dog until he's had a chance to think and adjust...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It's been five weeks...  another few won't kill me.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No. He wants him back. He'll be by tomorrow.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay by me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It's not my dog and this Simon seems to have enough on his mind -- but he did throw up twice and his spark is off.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Sure -- take him to the vet.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I did. And his stomach is out of whack. So they need him for a couple of days.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Do it.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: She's nice.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Really nice. Shouldn't that be a good thing... telling someone, 'no thanks required.'

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It looks like it really went over. You're sure making the rounds. Simon says you brought him soup last night. I hope he doesn't write you a note.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: "What?" Look at you... You sense a mark.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey -- you called me... I...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: About a dog.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yeah, but it's all about Simon now... you helped with the dog... And now there are other things. I'm just as concerned as you are about Simon.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Concerned. I'm just the hall monitor here.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: It's not only financial assistance. What he's got to do is go to Baltimore tomorrow and ask his parents for money. It's not going to happen on the phone.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yeah. If his parents are alive they've got to help -- those are the rules. Good.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Yes. And tomorrow? I have a high maintenance selling painter coming through... So I'm out. Can you take him?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Think white and get serious.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Take my car -- a convertible. Do you drive?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Like the wind but I'm not doing it.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay... so I'll see you tomorrow. Let's not drag this out. We don't enjoy another that much.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: If there's some mental health foundation that raises money to help people like you be sure to let me know.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Last word freak.

turns.speaker: HEAD WAITER
turns.text: Good evening.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hi. You have hard shells, right?

turns.speaker: HEAD WAITER
turns.text: Yes, we do... And I can give you a tie and jacket.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HEAD WAITER
turns.text: They require a tie and jacket but we have some available.

turns.speaker: HEAD WAITER
turns.text: Actually, I don't think so.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Wait here.

turns.speaker: HEAD WAITER
turns.text: Shall I get her for you?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No, it's all right. I'll just watch.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: How you doing, great one?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I haven't looked at myself yet. I figured I could tell from your reaction.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No. Please, don't force him.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: You little stinker. He's given you everything.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Sorry. What are those cards?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Frank's idea. He thought I should have notes so I did this right... maintained focus, didn't get emotional and tried not to terrify you.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Terrify me?

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: See, he's right. I need the cards.  Simon, you're broke.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: The medical bill are 61 thousand now. I've spoken to your parents and they didn't hang up or anything -- they just said they would feel strange calling you.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Well, I can't reach them.

turns.speaker: JACKIE
turns.text: Frank loves you. You know that... but I've spoken to him and he feels that --  -- as a businessman, with limited resources...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'll be able to keep my apartment and studio, won't I?...  Just tell me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Is he dead yet?

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: No! Would there be any way for you to be willing to walk his dog for him?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: Not just today -- Uh, could you do it -- until, until he gets back on his feet?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Sure thing.

turns.speaker: NORA
turns.text: You're a wonderful man. Two o'clock is a good time. Here's the key in case he's asleep. Open the curtains for him, so he sees God's beautiful work and knows that even things like this happen for the best.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Where'd they teach you to talk like this -- some Panama City "Sailor want to hump-hump bar"? Or was today getaway day and your last shot at his whiskey. Sell crazy some place else -- we're all stocked up here.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Okay. So you call 911 and don't leave your name -- even a dumb geezer should know that emergency automatically pulls up your name. How come you make a mistake like that?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: How come you're pretending to do cop work -- 'cause I don't think you could find your ass if you were spotted the hole.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Just move on. No one here killed him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Oh, is he dead?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Ask him.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: We will if we can and if we can't, we'll come back and ask you again and again.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Mr. Udall... excuse me. Hey there!  Have you seen Verdell?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's he look like?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: My dog... you know... I mean my little dog with the adorable face... Don't you know what my dog looks like?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I got it. You're talking about your dog. I thought that was the name of the colored man I've been seeing in the hall.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Which color was that?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Like thick molasses, with one of those wide noses perfect for smelling trouble and prison food...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Frank Sachs -- Melvin Udall.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: How're you doing?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Franks shows my work, Mr. Udall. I think you know that.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Mr. Udall, I'd like to talk to you please.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: 'Love was... '

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yeeeess!!!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Maybe this can wait.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I found Verdell, Mr. Udall.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, that's a load off.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Did you... do something to him?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Do you realize that I work at him?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No, I didn't.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Do you like to be interrupt when you are danging around in your little garden?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No...  actually, I even shut the phone off and put a little piece of cardboard in the ringer so no one can just buzz me from d...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, I work all the time. So never, never again interrupt me. Okay? I mean, never. Not 30 years from now... not if there's fire. Not even if you hear a thud from inside my home and a week later there's a smell from in there that can only come from a decaying body and you have to hold a hanky against your face because the stench is so thick you think you're going to faint even then don't come knocking or, if it's election night and you're excited and want to celebrate because some fudge-packer you dated has been elected the first queer President of the United States... and he's going to put you up in Camp David and you just want to share the moment with someone...  don't knock ...  not on this door. Not for anything. Got me. Sweetheart?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Yes. It's not a subtle point you're making.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay, then.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: That's some face they left hanging on you. You look like...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Could you take it just a little easy, Mr. Udall?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Thank you. Verdell...  sweetheart?  By the way, thanks for saving me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I called. I never touched you. I didn't leave my name or nothing.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Verdell?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Maybe I'll bring him some food by.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Thank you for walking him.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: If you'll excuse me I'm not feeling so well.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It smells like shit in here?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Go away.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: That cleaning woman doesn't...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Please, just leave.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Where are all your queer party friends?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Nothing worse than having to feel this way in front of you?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Nellie, you're a disgrace to depression.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Rot in hell, Melvin.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No need to stop being a lady... quit worrying -- you'll be back on your knees in no time.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, I'll do one thing for you that might cheer you up.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Don't piss on a gift, tough guy. You want to know why the dog prefers me...  it's not affection. It's a trick.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I carry bacon in my pocket.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Oh, my gosh.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Now we'll both call him.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Come on, sweetheart...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yo, yo, yo...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Would you leave now, please?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Stupid dog.  I don't get it.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I brought you Chinese soup.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I have never been so tired in my life. Okay, if I sit here?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Got any easier questions?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I haven't been sleeping. I haven't been clear or felt like myself. I'm in trouble. Some son of a bitch is burning my bridges behind my back...  But the tiredness -- boy...  Not just sleepy.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: But sick -- nauseous -- where everything looks distorted and everything inside just aches -- when you can barely get up the will to complain.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I, uh... I was... attacked. Walked in on people robbing me. I was hospitalized. I almost died.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Let's do the small talk in the car. Load up.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: That's very thoughtful.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Never a break. Never.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Well, I always painted. Always. And my mother always encouraged it. She was sort of fabulous about it actually... and she used to... I was too young to think there was anything at all wrong with it... and she was very natural. She used to pose nude for me... and I thought or assumed my father was aware of it.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: This stuff is pointless.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Not it at all, really.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Not at all, huh?!... Let's go to the hotel. And if you're lucky tomorrow Dad will give you another wad of sweaty money.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Do you ever get an erection for a woman?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Melvin...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Wouldn't your lie be a lot easier if you were not...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You consider your life easy.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I give you that one...  Nice packing.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I get why you're angry. It's no snap to explain why I was like that, but let's not try to do it on the run...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: ... so Mom. Truly no grudges -- truly. A little odd that you didn't come to see me when you heard I was hurt, but the important thing I want you to know is your son is happy. I'm working again. I'll make do -- I don't want a thing. Wouldn't take it if it was offered. I'll drop you a note from wherever I land and then it's up to you. I hope we patch things up but know that if we don't, I wish you both the very best... I can't hear you. You heard me, though, right? Good -- take good care. 'Bye.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: ... Now he's going to want to stay. And they'll want to take a ride to the lake or whatever. So it's a good five hours back. It gives us a chance to take it easy and...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'm going back with you.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What are you talking about? You got real problems.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I know. I'm a little bit nervous. Suddenly everything seems so easy. Carol, a load has been lifted.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Good-bye.  Well, your luck is holding. They sublet your place. You're homeless. Frank's got a line on another place you can use for now.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Another place where?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Does it matter?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I told you to go on in.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Look, I've got to get a hold of Frank and see where I'm hanging my hat 'cause...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I think you gotta camp it here...

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Thank you, Melvin. You overwhelm me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: They did a nice job... Cozy, huh?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Sorry, didn't know you were awake. I just thought Verdell shouldn't get too used to sleeping in here 'cause then...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Look, we both want the dog -- and...

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: You going to come talk to me or not?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: I'm coming.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: What did she say?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I'm a great guy -- "extraordinary"...  ... and she doesn't want contact with me.  I'm dying here.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Because...  ... you love her?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: No... and you're supposed to be sensitive and sharp.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Okay... you tell me why --  "You're dying here."

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I don't know... Let me sleep on it and figure it out.  Because I'm stuck! Can't go back to what I had... She's evicted me from my life.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Did you like it that much?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: It was better than this... Look, you, I'm very intelligent. If you're going to give me advice or conversation or consolation or hope, you got to be better than you're doing. If you can't be at least momentarily interesting than shut the hell up. I'm drowning and you're describing water.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Picking on me won't help.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Well, if that's true then I'm really in trouble.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: But you know where you're lucky?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Absolutely not.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: You know who you want. I'll take your seat any day. So do something... don't sleep on it... go over there. I don't think anybody should ever sleep on anything -- it's not always good to let things calm down.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Hey... I'm charged here. But she might kill me for showing up this late.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Then get in your jammies and I'll read you a story... I think you've got a chance. The only real enemy you have is her ability to think logically -- the best thing you have going for you is your willingness to humiliate yourself if it gives you one chance in whatever -- so go catch her off- guard.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Okay. Thanks a lot. Here I go.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I forgot to lock the door.

turns.speaker: ZOE
turns.text: I can't resist. You usually move through here so quickly and I have so many questions I want to ask you. You have no idea what your work means to me.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: What's it mean?

turns.speaker: ZOE
turns.text: That somebody out there knows what it's like to be...  in here.

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: Oh God, this is like a nightmare.

turns.speaker: ZOE
turns.text: Aw come on, just a couple of questions -- how hard is that?

turns.speaker: ZOE
turns.text: How do you write women so well?

turns.speaker: MELVIN
turns.text: I think of a man and take away reason and accountability.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Exactly what is your previous experience?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: How about that pose?  This is not fun...  Give me some direction.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Nothing. I just watch till something strikes me. Do anything you think of -- try different thing. Until I say, "hold that pose." Then just try and comfortably hold it.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: The fact that you haven't said, "hold it" means I haven't done it right...  is that correct? I haven't done it right?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: No...  Okay. What I do is watch and wait for, um... You ever watch someone who doesn't know you're watching...  an old woman on a bus, kids going to school and you see this flash come over them and you know immediately that it has nothing to do with anything external -- that it's in respond to a private thought they just had? They are just sort of realer and more alive. And when you notice it so are you. If you look at someone long enough, you discover their humanity.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: So you're practically finished, huh?

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Yes...  well, there's one more stage -- trying to figure out if it's any good.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Wait -- I want to see the painting.

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Just a second -- he has to go.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Please!! NO!!!

turns.speaker: SIMON
turns.text: Why are you doing this?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: No. No. No. Hey, that painting in there...  I just want to tell you...

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Is there a problem?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  No problem.  The airport, right?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Yeah.  Yeah, I'm a waiter.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What restaurant?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Uh, Fontella's

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: So you're from around here?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: No.  No I'm not.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Where you from?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Not too good at small talk, eh?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Look, I'm real tired and I'm not interested in fucking chit-chat.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I know just what you mean.  I'm pretty beat myself.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Why?  What happened?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Didn't you here all them sirens? It's been all over the radio.  Some guy shot Leevio Valli, and a bunch of bystanders, in the Trattoria Roma.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: No shit.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Yeah, it's terrible.  I mean Valli, and I don't care what office he's running for, the guy's a crook.  He probably had it coming, but all the other people.  Real sad.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: But they caught the guy.  I heard it all.  Sounded like he just went berserk, fucking loco.  Shooting anybody.  Drugs, probably.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I'd love to sit in that jury.  Send that S.O.B. right to the chair.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: That was Peterson back there.  That goes to the expressway for the airport.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You're right.  Talking too much again.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Yeah well, you just blew your tip, pal.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What?  You think I'm running you up?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Just do your job.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Get out.  You think I'm running you up?  Get out.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: You can't --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The hell I can't.  It's my cab.  I don't like you.  So, get the hell out!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Sit back.  Put your seatbelt on.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: No fucking way.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Okay, don't.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Boy, that's fucking genius.  You're a fucking genius.  Then you're just sitting there, bullshitting with me. Man, no way I coulda done that!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What's your name?  We both know it's not Nicholai.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Holy shit!  Robert Rath wants to know my name.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Bain.  Michael Bain.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: How long have you been freelance?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Two years.  Two long fucking years.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Hey.  What I don't get was why didn't you take the shot inside the restaurant?  I mean you had me, a free shot.  That's what I would have done.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It's just a shoot-out then.  Sixty- forty, at best.  Not my odds.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Sounds like chickenshit --

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: You don't have to tell me that. It's just, I know my bid was low, but was it too low?  I mean, did I seem like an amateur, like I didn't know what I was doing?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: We both know what you were doing.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Oh!  I got a question.  Jesus, this has been driving me crazy for years -- shit, listen to me.  I sound like some fucking fanboy.  I'm sorry, but I just got to ask you.  Everybody talks about how you left the Agency and got into the business and then how you went after the Russian, Nicholai Talinkov --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Tachlinkov.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Yeah, that's it.  And he's like a fucking genius.  They said he shaded you over and over.  And in the end, he aced you again.  Shaded and faded.  They say he's living on some Greek island, but I say that's fucking bullshit.  I say you're the best and that you planted his ass. Am I right?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Robert Bain, driving me!  Jesus fucking Christ!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: After those cops, you'll never be able to come back to Cleveland.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Who the fuck cares about Cleveland. Cleveland blows.  What kind of marks have they got here?  Greasy mobster, teamster or some hand job politician.  I want the money marks. I want the marks that you get.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: So what happens now?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: We go around once.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What?  What's okay?

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: There's a sand barricade up ahead; I'm going to ram this cab into it. The cab has an airbag, odds are good I'll survive.  But with this steel casing and bullet proof glass, odds for you are not so good.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: No, no.  Wait.  You don't want me to jump.  You're going to jump.  I'm stuck back here until it's too late. Wham -- over!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I know you're going to jump.
